dagtex 0.1.0
  • Reference

Save the DAG image

save_dag.Rd

Save the DAG image

save_dag(
  dag,
  filename,
  filetype = "png",
  density = getOption("dagtex.density"),
  is_latex_code = FALSE,
  is_swig = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

dag

An object created by dagtex() (or the LaTex code generated by passing such an object to get_latex_code()).
filename

A filepath to create with saved DAG. The filetype (e.g., pdf, png, jpg) will be extracted from the path if included in the path.
filetype

The desired image format, if not provided as part of the filename. Defaults to 'png', but can be any format accepted by magick::image_write().
density

Numeric. Passed to texPreview::tex_preview() to control the density of the image.
is_latex_code

Logical. Whether dag is TikZ code for drawing the DAG directly. Defaults to (and generally is) FALSE.
is_swig

Logical. Whether the graph is a SWIG (has any split nodes). Defaults to FALSE.
...

Arguments passed to texPreview::tex_preview().

Value

An image saved to disk; also shows up in the Viewer.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
dagtex() %>%
  add_many_nodes(c("A", "B", "C")) %>%
  complete_dag() %>%
  save_dag("path/to/my/dag.png")
}
